description:
The continuation of Yu-Gi-Oh! Zexal.

A new enemy has been revealed - Barian. They wish to gather the "Numbers" and destroy the Astral World to avoid their own world's destruction. As such, Yuma and his friends are their prime target, and the Barian begin to slowly enter Heartland City.

tags.name: Card Battle
tags.description: Centers around individuals competing in card games.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Cyberpunk
tags.description: Set in a future of advanced technological and scientific achievements that have resulted in social disorder.

node.description:
The creator of Yu-Gi-Oh! He loved playing shogi, mahjong, card games, and tabletop role-playing games.

In an interview with Shonen Jump, Takahashi stated that his favorite manga from other authors included Akira by Katsuhiro Otomo, JoJo's Bizarre Adventure by Hirohiko Araki, and Dragon Ball by Akira Toriyama. He also enjoyed reading American comics, with Hellboy being his favorite American comic book character.

On July 6, 2022, a body in snorkeling gear was found off the coast of Nago City, Okinawa, which was identified the following day as Takahashi. It was revealed by a U.S. Army Officer that Takahashi attempted to aid in the rescue of three people at a riptide in Mermaid's Grotto, Onna, on July 4, 2022.

vistlip formed on the auspicious date of July 7, 2007 with members from all over Japan: vocalist Tomo from Fukuoka, Kyushu, Tokyo-born guitarists Yuh and Umi, who also does rap vocals and is responsible for bringing the group together, bassist Rui from Hyogo and Kanagawa native Tohya on drums.

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)

[Website](https://www.universal-music.co.jp/petit-milady/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/petitmilady) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCXMlgSrADF3FEkbW5CEHj8g)

__Members:__ [Aoi Yuuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101686) & [Ayana Taketatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101996)

A voice actress duo unit. Together, they have performed the opening and ending themes for various anime, including the song "Kagami no Dual-ism", which was used as the third opening theme to [Yu-Gi-Oh! Zexal II](https://anilist.co/anime/15489/), the song "Azurite", which was used as the opening theme for [The Pilot's Love Song](https://anilist.co/anime/19117/), the song "Seishun wa Tabemono desu", used as the opening theme for [Pan de Peace](https://anilist.co/anime/21315/), the song "A or A!?", used as the opening theme for [Alice or Alice](https://anilist.co/anime/99638/).

The name of the unit is a reference to the fact that Aoi Yuuki and Ayana Taketatsu are small (their heights are 144.5 and 151 cm respectively) and cute girls.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1314120680091209728)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [animator](https://anilist.co/staff/154741/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/325492584) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=tatsuya_yoshihara)

Freelance animator formerly affiliated with [Actas](https://anilist.co/studio/60/) where he was attending its internal animation school and debuted as animator at the age of 20. His work has been greatly influenced by contemporary Kanada school animators [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/) and [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/). 

He's a precocious talent, debuting as episode director at the age of 21 and as director at the age of 23 with [Arve Rezzle](https://anilist.co/anime/13863/), as part of the Young Animator Training Project.

Married to fellow animator [Kikuko Sadakata](https://anilist.co/staff/105769).

[Twitter](https://x.com/GilboNoh)

Animator best known for his work on the *Yu-Gi-Oh!* series.
